channel.title: Comments on: Using a Calendar for a Date Hierarchy Parameter with SSAS 2008 and SSRS 2008
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
Do we need to download http://msftasprodsamples.codeplex.com/Wiki/View.aspx?title=SS2008!Readme_AMOAdventureWorks to make it work?

I wanted to try this out, but the instructions are not precise for me as what I have to set up first.

I have AdventureWorks 6 different databases installed.

Could you please expand your blog a bit for a newbie like me?

Thanks again.

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
Yes, 2008 has some good improvements but 2005 was pretty good at the same time. I still think the best rapid report development platform out there. most of all for developers taking it on with little training.

Now 2000 SSRS is a different story ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: you know one of these days I will give SSRS a shot....I heard it is much improved with the 2008 version<br />
